title: Large-Scale Computational Thinking Learning Design Based on Embodied Cognition

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Designing embodied learning activities using basic smartphone functions in a limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can recognize and explain mathematical patterns through physical activities (e.g., hand gestures, spatial movement).
Learners can abstract and express everyday movements (e.g., climbing stairs) as algorithmic steps.
Learners can solve complex math problems by decomposing, identifying patterns, and generalizing based on embodied cognitive activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
